refnamediv.refpurpose: Displays a box with a grid useful for visualizing two-dimensional Hyper Vectorial Synthesis.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: FLhvsBox displays a box with a grid useful for visualizing two-dimensional Hyper Vectorial Synthesis.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: ihandle FLhvsBox inumlinesX, inumlinesY, iwidth, iheight, ix, iy

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ihandle â€“ an integer number used a univocally-defined handle for identifying a specific HVS box (see below).
inumlinesX, inumlinesY - number of vertical and horizontal lines delimiting the HVS squared areas
iwidth, iheight - width and height of the HVS box
ix, iy - the position of the HVS box

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: FLhvsBox is a widget able to visualize current position of the HVS cursor in an HVS box (i.e. a squared area containing a grid). The number of horizontal and vertical lines of the grid can be defined with the inumlinesX, inumlinesY arguments. This opcode has to be declared inside an FLpanel - FLpanelEnd block. See the entry for hvs2 for an example of usage of FLhvsBox.
FLhvsBoxSetValue is used to set the cursor position of an FLhvsBox widget.
